medical_history.chief_complaint: Recurrent spells of throbbing headache, palpitations, diaphoresis, and anxiety.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Initially diagnosed in 1972 with symptoms recurring until 1979 when he presented with low back and hip pain. Over the next decade, he developed complete occlusion of the inferior vena cava, and his metastatic lesion remained unchanged. Symptoms of left lower back pain occurred 5 months prior to the last evaluation in October 2001. Despite various surgeries and radiation therapy, catecholamine levels remained elevated and stable.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Metastatic catecholamine-secreting paraganglioma diagnosed in 1972, underwent surgical resection and radiation therapy; persistent elevated catecholamines postoperatively.
medical_history.family_history: Family history of malignant catecholamine-secreting paragangliomas with his son being diagnosed with hypertension and paragangliomas.
